refnamediv.refpurpose: how to create a simple rectangle line graph.

refsect1.title: Curves with areas in a rectangle background box
refsect1.para: Here's a complete example application that creates a #GooCanvas with a rectangle graph and two curves in it. The curves are drawn with areas to the Y-value 0.0 (zero)). Due to transparency (alpha < 255) the cross section is high-lighted.

figure.title: Curves with areas in a rectangle grid

refsect1.para: And here's the same example code in FreeBasic syntax

As you can see there're very little differences between the two syntaxes. It's easier to read the FreeBasic Syntax so further examples will be shown in this language. Find more examples in the chapter Examples (or by clicking on the images in the Gallery ). Just remove the GooData code and replace it by the new one.
